div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 459 Chisineu Cris (formerly Kisjenö), c. 36 km. N of Arad, Rumania, 1835 Burial: 225-200 B.C. (T) Contents: 263 AR Imit. Philip II: 24+ tetradr. Alexander III: 57 tetradr. Lysimachus: 50 tetradr. Seleucus I: 5 tetradr. (Coins very worn, ctmk. and cut) Disposition: Vienna 131 (19 imit. and all other entries, some merged with gen- eral collection); private colls. (some imit.) Arneth, Gold- and Silbermonumente (Wien, 1850), p. 8 Pink, Münzprägung der Ostkelten, p. 35
